creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Kundika (holy water bottle) high shouldered, ovoid body with tall neck and small spout; celadon, olive green glaze
text: The elegant shape of the ritual bronze kundika was so admired during the Goryeo dynasty that potters also produced porcelain examples with celadon glaze. The aristocracy used these vessels for decoration.
title: Water Vessel
